turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: In pre-Islamic Arabia, neither poppy nor hemp was known.
turn.6: Hemp was introduced into the Islamic countries in the ninth century from India through Persia and Greek culture and medical literature.

turn.8: The Greek, Dioscorides, who according to the Arabs is the greatest botanist of antiquity, recommended hemp seeds to "quench geniture" and its juice for earaches.
turn.9: Was the poppy used for anything else?
turn.10: Beginning in 800 and lasting for over two centuries, poppy use was restricted to the therapeutic realm.
